head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Judge Adds Lawyer In Ferry Case

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Judge Adds Lawyer In Ferry Case

body.head.byline: By Sewell Chan (NYT); Compiled by John Sullivan

block.p: A federal judge assigned an additional lawyer yesterday to represent a former assistant captain of a Staten Island ferry who pleaded guilty last August to seaman's manslaughter in connection with the Oct. 15, 2003, crash in which 11 people died. Judge Edward R. Korman of Federal District Court in Brooklyn criticized defense lawyers and assigned Peter Kirchheimer of the Legal Aid Society to represent the assistant captain, Richard J. Smith, in sentencing hearings. The judge questioned Mr. Smith's decision to admit recklessness in his guilty plea.
